intro: Uragoga curviflora var. lanceolata, commonly known as the lanceleaf uragoga, is a tropical plant characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and showy, clustered flowers. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is native to regions of Southeast Asia. The plant typically grows as an understory species in humid, shaded environments. Its foliage is often used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties. The flowers, which bloom in clusters, are usually white or pale yellow and attract various pollinators.
